title: How to Make Koki (Sindhi Flat Bread)

steps.headline: Chop the onions and chillies finely, if not already done.

text: Chop the onions and chillies finely, if not already done. Take care with the chillies––do not wipe your fingers in your eyes or nose after cutting chillies. Place the flour, chopped chillies and onions, coriander leaves, cumin seeds  and salt into the mixing bowl.  Add the ghee or oil and mix together. Mix until a dough forms. Divide the dough into three to four pieces.  Roll out each piece to flatten it into a circle.  Place a little oil in the frying pan or skillet. Heat over a medium heat, or slightly lower. Add the first koki and gently heat on both sides until browned slightly in spots.  Remove from the heat. Repeat with the remaining dough pieces. Serve. It goes well with a meal, by itself as a snack, or with a cup of tea.
